SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To evaluate visual field loss using multifocal ERG(m-ERG), multifocal VEP(m-VEP), and Heidelberg Retina Flowmeter(HRF) in a patient with branch retinal artery occlusion(BRAO) and brain infarction
CASE: A 38-year-old man noticed inferior-nasal visual field loss in the left eye, and was referred to Keio University Hospital
He suffered from paralysis in the left leg due to brain infarction at the age of 24
However, he had not noticed visual field loss due to the brain infarction
His left fundus showed retinal edema in the area of a superior-temporal retinal artery occulusion
He was diagnosed as having BRAO
The Goldmann and Humphry perimetric examinations revealed homonymous quadrantanopia in the upper left field as well as inferior visual field defect in the left eye
RESULTS: Both m-ERG and m-VEP, especially second-kernel responses, were reduced in the affected retinal area of BRAO
But only m-VEP was affected in the corresponding area of homonymous quadrantanopia in the upper left field
The retinal flow in the area with BRAO evaluated by HRF was decreased in some areas and not in others, suggesting that retinal function was not necessarily consistent with retinal circulation
CONCLUSIONS: m-ERG and m-VEP are useful To differentiate retinal lesions from brain lesions in visual field loss
